page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW OF NENTHEAD
page.content: Our survey block covers the village of Nenthead and surrounding hill land. Nenthead is a ward of the parish of Alston Moor, it is located on the Eden District Border of Cumbria, almost at the meeting point of Durham and Northumberland. It lies in an isolated position four miles south_east of the small market town of Alston. Nenthead's main access is by the A689 from Alston to the north_west and from Weardale in county Durham from the south_east. The altitude of our block is 1400-1600ft.<432-490 metres>making it amongst the highest populated land in Britain.Precipitation is 49.6inches <1260mm>annually.Snow can lie for several weeks.However the village is rarely cut off by heavy snowfall. This once thriving mining village of the eighteenth and nineteenth century now strives to attract people back.
